sub_title: PhD Candidate at Eindhoven University of Technology
summary:
Currently I am a PhD candidate at the Eindhoven University of Technology in the Applied Physics department . I am part of the CONSENSE network, which is a project funded by the European Commission, and gathers scientists, as well as companies into one common aim: The development of the next generation of biosensors for continuous biomarker monitoring.


Moreover, I am a bachelor in Materials Engineer graduated from the Federal University of São Paulo, and a Master of Science with a double-degree Physical-Chemistry and Materials Science in collaboration with three European Universities: Université Paris Saclay (FR), University of Genova (IT) and University of Porto (PT).  I was awarded a full scholarship from the European Commission to be part of the SERP+ program, an International Master programme in Surface, Electro, Radiation, and Photo-Chemistry with elements of Management, Business, Innovation and Valorisation, Communication and Patent law. 

Worked at Ontex, developing business insights based on data intelligence, also producing novel reports.. Dealed with data extraction, treatment and modelling, used softwares as Access (Design mode and SQL language) and Excel. Previously was a Supply Chain intern at BASF S.A., position which I could experience the corporate environment and also learn about operations, financial analysis, SAP, different KPIs, etc. I also took a technical internship in 2014 in materials development, which I was responsible for maintaining all the experiments of the lab running properly. Hard-worker, proactive and I have passion to learn.

profile_positions.description: We are developing a plasmonic optical sensor with single-molecule resolution for continuous biomarker monitoring. This type of biosensors will revolutionize health care, for example, by enabling early stage disease detection as well as personalized medication monitoring and administration.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

profile_positions.description: The project aims at incorporating electrofluorochromic (EFC) molecules on plasmonic nanoparticles. Once coated on surfaces, these latter will serve as electrodes to electrochemically address the EFC molecules in order to tune their redox state and thus their emission properties in relation with the possible activation of plasmonic properties as well.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
The International Master SERP+ is a two-year programme in Surface, Electro, Radiation, and Photo-Chemistry with elements of Management, Business, Innovation and Valorisation, Communication and Patent law. The Master SERP+ aims at training students in the most performing experimental and theoretical tools used and developed in chemistry, and to become the topmost researchers and managers in areas of great relevance such as:

Green chemistry based on photon-induced reactions,
Nanomedicine and renewable energies, applications of radiations,
Catalysis and industrial processes based on innovative surface treatments and modification
Environment concerns

profile_positions.description:
Materials Engineer with a minor in Science and Technology. 

I was involved in several projects that was part of my academic development. 

I was part of the Bioceramics group within the University, where I developed my graduation project. I produced PCL/HA fibers by rotary-jet spinning process, a simple and cheap method. Besides producing the biomaterial, I also characterized it with various methods (SEM, Raman Spectroscopy, DSC, etc) and tested it in simulated-body fluid, corroborating that the material was bioactive and could be used as a biomaterial. The results of my work were presented at XVI Bra Brazilian Materials Research Society Meeting.
